info.description: This API is for development and testing purposes.
info.title: PMM API

post.summary: Get gets map of metrics names.

schema.description: FiltersRequest contains period for which we need filters.

items.description: MapFieldEntry allows to pass labels/dimensions in form like {"server": ["db1", "db2"...]}.

schema.description:
FiltersReply is map of labels for given period by key.
Key is label's name and value is label's value and how many times it occur.

additionalProperties.description: ListLabels is list of label's values: duplicates are impossible.

items.description: Values is label values and main metric percent and per second.

post.summary: GetMetricsNames gets map of metrics names.
GetReport returns list of metrics group by queryid or other dimentions.

schema.description: ReportRequest defines filtering of metrics report for db server or other dimentions.

items.description: ReportMapFieldEntry allows to pass labels/dimentions in form like {"server": ["db1", "db2"...]}.

schema.description: ReportReply is list of reports per quieryids, hosts etc.

items.description: Row define metrics for selected dimention.

stats.description: Stat is statistics of specific metric.

items.description:
Point contains values that represents abscissa (time) and ordinate (volume etc.)
of every point in a coordinate system of Sparklines.

point.description: The serial number of the chart point from the largest time in the time interval to the lowest time in the time range.

timestamp.description: Time of point in format RFC3339.

m_query_time_sum_per_sec.description: The statement execution time in seconds.

m_lock_time_sum_per_sec.description: The time to acquire locks in seconds.

m_rows_sent_sum_per_sec.description: The number of rows sent to the client.

m_rows_affected_sum_per_sec.description: Number of rows changed - UPDATE, DELETE, INSERT.

m_rows_read_sum_per_sec.description: The number of rows read from tables.

m_merge_passes_sum_per_sec.description: The number of merge passes that the sort algorithm has had to do.

m_innodb_io_r_ops_sum_per_sec.description: Counts the number of page read operations scheduled.

m_innodb_io_r_bytes_sum_per_sec.description: Similar to innodb_IO_r_ops, but the unit is bytes.

m_innodb_io_r_wait_sum_per_sec.description: Shows how long (in seconds) it took InnoDB to actually read the data from storage.

m_innodb_rec_lock_wait_sum_per_sec.description: Shows how long (in seconds) the query waited for row locks.

m_innodb_queue_wait_sum_per_sec.description: Shows how long (in seconds) the query spent either waiting to enter the InnoDB queue or inside that queue waiting for execution.

m_innodb_pages_distinct_sum_per_sec.description: Counts approximately the number of unique pages the query accessed.

m_query_length_sum_per_sec.description: Shows how long the query is.

m_bytes_sent_sum_per_sec.description: The number of bytes sent to all clients.

m_tmp_tables_sum_per_sec.description: Number of temporary tables created on memory for the query.

m_tmp_disk_tables_sum_per_sec.description: Number of temporary tables created on disk for the query.

m_tmp_table_sizes_sum_per_sec.description: Total Size in bytes for all temporary tables used in the query.

m_qc_hit_sum_per_sec.description:
Boolean metrics:
- *_sum_per_sec - how many times this matric was true.

Query Cache hits.

m_full_scan_sum_per_sec.description: The query performed a full table scan.

m_full_join_sum_per_sec.description: The query performed a full join (a join without indexes).

m_tmp_table_sum_per_sec.description: The query created an implicit internal temporary table.

m_tmp_table_on_disk_sum_per_sec.description: The querys temporary table was stored on disk.

m_filesort_on_disk_sum_per_sec.description: The filesort was performed on disk.

m_select_full_range_join_sum_per_sec.description: The number of joins that used a range search on a reference table.

m_select_range_sum_per_sec.description: The number of joins that used ranges on the first table.

m_select_range_check_sum_per_sec.description: The number of joins without keys that check for key usage after each row.

m_sort_range_sum_per_sec.description: The number of sorts that were done using ranges.

m_sort_scan_sum_per_sec.description: The number of sorts that were done by scanning the table.

m_no_index_used_sum_per_sec.description: The number of queries without index.

m_no_good_index_used_sum_per_sec.description: The number of queries without good index.

m_docs_returned_sum_per_sec.description:
MongoDB metrics.

The number of returned documents.

m_response_length_sum_per_sec.description: The response length of the query result in bytes.

m_shared_blks_hit_sum_per_sec.description:
PostgreSQL metrics.

Total number of shared block cache hits by the statement.

m_shared_blks_read_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of shared blocks read by the statement.

m_shared_blks_dirtied_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of shared blocks dirtied by the statement.

m_shared_blks_written_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of shared blocks written by the statement.

m_local_blks_hit_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of local block cache hits by the statement.

m_local_blks_read_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of local blocks read by the statement.

m_local_blks_dirtied_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of local blocks dirtied by the statement.

m_local_blks_written_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of local blocks written by the statement.

m_temp_blks_read_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of temp blocks read by the statement.

m_temp_blks_written_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of temp blocks written by the statement.

m_blk_read_time_sum_per_sec.description: Total time the statement spent reading blocks, in milliseconds (if track_io_timing is enabled, otherwise zero).

m_blk_write_time_sum_per_sec.description: Total time the statement spent writing blocks, in milliseconds (if track_io_timing is enabled, otherwise zero).

m_cpu_user_time_sum_per_sec.description: Total time user spent in query.

m_cpu_sys_time_sum_per_sec.description: Total time system spent in query.

m_wal_records_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of WAL (Write-ahead logging) records.

m_wal_fpi_sum_per_sec.description: Total number of FPI (full page images) in WAL (Write-ahead logging) records.

m_wal_bytes_sum_per_sec.description: Total bytes of WAL (Write-ahead logging) records.

post.summary: GetHistogram gets histogram items for specific filtering.

schema.description: HistogramRequest defines filtering by time range, labels and queryid.

items.description: MapFieldEntry allows to pass labels/dimensions in form like {"server": ["db1", "db2"...]}.

schema.description: HistogramReply is histogram items as a list.

items.description: HistogramItem represents one item in histogram.

post.summary: GetLabels gets list of labels for object details.

schema.description:
ObjectDetailsLabelsRequest defines filtering of object detail's labels for specific value of
dimension (ex.: host=hostname1 or queryid=1D410B4BE5060972.
ObjectDetailsLabelsReply is a map of labels names as keys and labels values as a list.

additionalProperties.description: ListLabelValues is list of label's values.

post.summary: GetMetrics gets map of metrics for specific filtering.

schema.description: MetricsRequest defines filtering of metrics for specific value of dimension (ex.: host=hostname1 or queryid=1D410B4BE5060972.

items.description: MapFieldEntry allows to pass labels/dimensions in form like {"server": ["db1", "db2"...]}.

totals.title: retrieve only values for totals, excluding N/A values

schema.description: MetricsReply defines metrics for specific value of dimension (ex.: host=hostname1 or queryid=1D410B4BE5060972.

additionalProperties.description: MetricValues is statistics of specific metric.

items.description:
Point contains values that represents abscissa (time) and ordinate (volume etc.)
of every point in a coordinate system of Sparklines.

point.description: The serial number of the chart point from the largest time in the time interval to the lowest time in the time range.

timestamp.description: Time of point in format RFC3339.

m_innodb_queue_wait_sum_per_sec.description: Shows how long (in seconds) the query spent either waiting to enter the InnoDB queue or inside that queue waiting for execution.

m_query_length_sum_per_sec.description: Shows how long the query is.

m_bytes_sent_sum_per_sec.description: The number of bytes sent to all clients.

m_tmp_tables_sum_per_sec.description: Number of temporary tables created on memory for the query.

m_tmp_disk_tables_sum_per_sec.description: Number of temporary tables created on disk for the query.

m_tmp_table_sizes_sum_per_sec.description: Total Size in bytes for all temporary tables used in the query.

Boolean metrics:
- *_sum_per_sec - how many times this matric was true.

Query Cache hits.

m_full_scan_sum_per_sec.description: The query performed a full table scan.

m_full_join_sum_per_sec.description: The query performed a full join (a join without indexes).

m_tmp_table_sum_per_sec.description: The query created an implicit internal temporary table.

m_no_index_used_sum_per_sec.description: The number of queries without index.

m_no_good_index_used_sum_per_sec.description: The number of queries without good index.

m_docs_returned_sum_per_sec.description:
MongoDB metrics.

The number of returned documents.

m_response_length_sum_per_sec.description: The response length of the query result in bytes.

PostgreSQL metrics.

Total number of shared block cache hits by the statement.

additionalProperties.description: MetricValues is statistics of specific metric.

post.summary: GetQueryExample gets list of query examples.

schema.description:
QueryExampleRequest defines filtering of query examples for specific value of
dimension (ex.: host=hostname1 or queryid=1D410B4BE5060972.

items.description: MapFieldEntry allows to pass labels/dimensions in form like {"server": ["db1", "db2"...]}.
QueryExample shows query examples and their metrics.

example_format.description:
ExampleFormat is format of query example: real or query without values.

Deprecated: is not used, should not be used, should be removed.

example_type.description: ExampleType is a type of query example selected for this query class in given period of time.

post.summary: GetQueryPlan gets query plan and plan id for specific filtering.
QueryExists check if query exists in clickhouse.

schema.description: QueryExistsRequest check if provided query exists or not.

post.description: Connect a PMM server to the organization created on Percona Portal. That allows the user to sign in to the PMM server with their Percona Account.
post.summary: Connect

server_name.description: User defined human readable PMM Server Name.

personal_access_token.description: Personal Access Token that the user obtains from Percona Portal.

post.description: Disconnect a PMM server from the organization created on Percona Portal.
post.summary: Disconnect

force.title: Forces the cleanup process for connected PMM instances regardless of the Portal API response

post.description: GetContactInformation fetches the contact details of the customer success employee handling the Percona customer account from Percona Platform.
post.summary: GetContactInformation

customer_success.description: CustomerSuccess contains the contanct details of the customer success employee assigned to a customer's account.

new_ticket_url.description: URL to open a new support ticket.

post.description: SearchOrganizationEntitlements fetches details of the entitlement's available to the Portal organization that the PMM server is connected to.
post.summary: SearchOrganizationEntitlements

items.description: OrganizationEntitlement contains information about Organization entitlement.

total_units.description: Total units covered by this entitlement.

unlimited_units.description: Flag indicates that unlimited units are covered.

support_level.description: Support level covered by this entitlement.

software_families.description: Percona product families covered by this entitlement.

start_date.description:
Entitlement start data.
Note: only date is used here but not time.

end_date.description:
Entitlement end date.
Note: only date is used here but not time.

security_advisor.description: Flag indicates that security advisors are covered by this entitlement.

config_advisor.description: Flag indicates that config advisors are covered by this entitlement.

post.description: SearchOrganizationTickets searches support tickets belonging to the Percona Portal Organization that the PMM server is connected to.
post.summary: SearchOrganizationTickets

tickets.description: Support tickets belonging to the Percona Portal Organization.

items.description: OrganizationTicket contains information about the support ticket.

post.description: ServerInfo returns PMM server ID and name.
post.summary: ServerInfo

post.description: UserStatus returns a boolean indicating whether the current user is logged in with their Percona Account or not.
post.summary: UserStatus
ChangePSMDBComponents manages PSMDB related components.

mongod.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

post.summary: ChangePXCComponents manages PXC related components.

pxc.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

proxysql.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

haproxy.description: ChangeComponent contains fields to manage components.

items.description: ComponentVersion contains operations which should be done with component version.

post.summary: CheckForOperatorUpdate checks if a new version of an operator is available.

cluster_to_components.description: The cluster name is used as a key for this map, value contains components and their inforamtion about update.

additionalProperties.description: ComponentsUpdateInformation contains info about components and their available latest versions.

component_to_update_information.description:
component_to_update_information stores, under the name of the component, information about the update.
"pxc-operator", "psmdb-operator" are names used by backend for our operators.

additionalProperties.description: ComponentUpdateInformation contains version we can update to for certain component.

post.summary: GetPSMDBComponents returns list of available components for PSMDB Clusters.

items.description: OperatorVersion contains information about operator and components matrix.

post.summary: GetPXCComponents returns list of available components for PXC Clusters.

items.description: OperatorVersion contains information about operator and components matrix.

post.summary: InstallOperator installs given operator in given version.

operator_type.description: operator_type tells what operator we are interested in updating.

version.description: version tells what version of the operator we should update to.

status.description:
OperatorsStatus defines status of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

 - OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID: OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_OK: OPERATORS_STATUS_OK represents that operators are installed and have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED: OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED represents that operators are installed, but doesn't have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED represents that operators are not installed.

post.summary: DeleteDBCluster deletes DB cluster.

cluster_type.description:
DBClusterType represents database cluster type.

 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_INVALID: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_INVALID represents unknown cluster type.
 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PXC: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PXC represents pxc cluster type.
 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PSMDB: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PSMDB represents psmdb cluster type.

post.summary: ListDBClusters returns a list of DB clusters.

items.description: PXCCluster represents PXC cluster information.

state.description:
DBClusterState represents DB cluster CR state.

 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_INVALID: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING represents a cluster being changed.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_READY: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_READY represents a cluster without pending changes.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_FAILED: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_FAILED represents a failed cluster.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_DELETING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_DELETING represents a cluster being deleting.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_PAUSED: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_PAUSED represents a cluster is paused.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_UPGRADING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_UPGRADING is a special case of DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING.
It indicates database cluster upgrade is ongoing.

finished_steps.description: Finished steps of the operaion; can decrease or increase compared to the previous value.

message.description: Text describing the current operation progress step.

total_steps.description: Total steps needed to finish the operation; can decrease or increase compared to the previous value.

params.description: PXCClusterParams represents PXC cluster parameters that can be updated.

pxc.description:
PXC container parameters.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

compute_resources.description: ComputeResources represents container computer resources requests or limits.

proxysql.description:
ProxySQL container parameters.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

compute_resources.description: ComputeResources represents container computer resources requests or limits.

haproxy.description:
HAProxy container parameters.
NOTE: HAProxy does not need disk size as ProxySQL does because the container does not require it.

compute_resources.description: ComputeResources represents container computer resources requests or limits.

exposed.description: DB cluster accessible outside of K8s cluster.

available_image.description:
Available database version user can upgrade cluster to, returned as an image. Image tag contains the version.
If it's empty, no upgrade is available.

items.description: PSMDBCluster represents PSMDB cluster information.

state.description:
DBClusterState represents DB cluster CR state.

 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_INVALID: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING represents a cluster being changed.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_READY: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_READY represents a cluster without pending changes.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_FAILED: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_FAILED represents a failed cluster.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_DELETING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_DELETING represents a cluster being deleting.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_PAUSED: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_PAUSED represents a cluster is paused.
 - DB_CLUSTER_STATE_UPGRADING: DB_CLUSTER_STATE_UPGRADING is a special case of DB_CLUSTER_STATE_CHANGING.
It indicates database cluster upgrade is ongoing.

finished_steps.description: Finished steps of the operaion; can decrease or increase compared to the previous value.

message.description: Text describing the current operation progress step.

total_steps.description: Total steps needed to finish the operation; can decrease or increase compared to the previous value.

params.description: PSMDBClusterParams represents PSMDB cluster parameters that can be updated.

replicaset.description:
ReplicaSet container parameters.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

compute_resources.description: ComputeResources represents container computer resources requests or limits.

exposed.description: DB cluster accessible outside of K8s cluster.

available_image.description:
Available database version user can upgrade cluster to, returned as an image. Image tag contains the version.
If it's empty, no upgrade is available.

post.summary: RestartDBCluster restarts DB cluster.

cluster_type.description:
DBClusterType represents database cluster type.

 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_INVALID: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_INVALID represents unknown cluster type.
 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PXC: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PXC represents pxc cluster type.
 - DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PSMDB: DB_CLUSTER_TYPE_PSMDB represents psmdb cluster type.

post.summary: GetLogs gets all logs from db cluster.

logs.description:
Log represents list of logs. Each entry contains either container's logs or,
when container field is empty, pod's events.

items.description:
Logs contain logs for certain pod's container. If container is an empty
string, logs contain pod's events.

logs.description: Content of container's log or pod's events.

post.summary: GetKubernetesCluster return KubeAuth with Kubernetes config.

kube_auth.description: KubeAuth represents Kubernetes / kubectl authentication and authorization information.

post.summary: ListKubernetesClusters returns a list of all registered Kubernetes clusters.

items.description:
Cluster contains public info about Kubernetes cluster.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

operators.description: Operators contains list of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

pxc.description: Operator contains all information about operator installed in Kubernetes cluster.

status.description:
OperatorsStatus defines status of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

 - OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID: OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_OK: OPERATORS_STATUS_OK represents that operators are installed and have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED: OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED represents that operators are installed, but doesn't have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED represents that operators are not installed.

psmdb.description: Operator contains all information about operator installed in Kubernetes cluster.

status.description:
OperatorsStatus defines status of operators installed in Kubernetes cluster.

 - OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID: OPERATORS_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_OK: OPERATORS_STATUS_OK represents that operators are installed and have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED: OPERATORS_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED represents that operators are installed, but doesn't have supported API version.
 - OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED: OPERATORS_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED represents that operators are not installed.

KubernetesClusterStatus defines status of Kubernetes cluster.

 - KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_INVALID: KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_INVALID represents unknown state.
 - KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_OK: KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_OK represents that Kubernetes cluster is accessible.
 - KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_UNAVAILABLE: KUBERNETES_CLUSTER_STATUS_UNAVAILABLE represents that Kubernetes cluster is not accessible.

post.summary: RegisterKubernetesCluster registers an existing Kubernetes cluster in PMM.

kube_auth.description: KubeAuth represents Kubernetes / kubectl authentication and authorization information.

aws_access_key_id.description: AWS access key id, only needed when registering EKS cluster and kubeconfig does not contain it.

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key, only needed when registering EKS cluster and kubeconfig does not contain it.

post.summary:
GetResources returns all and available resources of a Kubernetes cluster.
NOTE: The user defined in kubeconfig for the cluster has to have rights to
      list and get Pods from all Namespaces. Also getting and listing Nodes
      has to be allowed.

cpu_m.description:
CPU in millicpus. For example 0.1 of CPU is equivalent to 100 millicpus.
See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-cpu.

CPU in millicpus. For example 0.1 of CPU is equivalent to 100 millicpus.
See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-cpu.

post.summary: UnregisterKubernetesCluster removes a registered Kubernetes cluster from PMM.

force.description:
If true then Kubernetes cluster will be deleted
even if it contains database clusters.

post.summary: CreatePSMDBCluster creates a new PSMDB cluster.

name.title:
PSMDB cluster name.
a DNS-1035 label must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or '-',
start with an alphabetic character, and end with an alphanumeric character
(e.g. 'my-name',  or 'abc-123', regex used for validation is '[a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?')

params.description: PSMDBClusterParams represents PSMDB cluster parameters that can be updated.

replicaset.description:
ReplicaSet container parameters.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

compute_resources.description: ComputeResources represents container computer resources requests or limits.

expose.description: Make DB cluster accessible outside of K8s cluster.

post.summary: GetPSMDBClusterResources returns expected resources to be consumed by the cluster.

params.description: PSMDBClusterParams represents PSMDB cluster parameters that can be updated.

replicaset.description:
ReplicaSet container parameters.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

compute_resources.description: ComputeResources represents container computer resources requests or limits.

cpu_m.description:
CPU in millicpus. For example 0.1 of CPU is equivalent to 100 millicpus.
See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#meaning-of-cpu.

post.summary: UpdatePSMDBCluster updates existing PSMDB cluster.

params.description: UpdatePSMDBClusterParams represents PSMDB cluster parameters that can be updated.

compute_resources.description: ComputeResources represents container computer resources requests or limits.

image.description:
PSMDB image to use. If it's the same image but with different version tag, upgrade of database cluster to version
in given tag is triggered. If entirely different image is given, error is returned.

post.summary: GetPSMDBClusterCredentials returns a PSMDB cluster credentials by cluster name.

connection_credentials.description:
PSMDBCredentials is a credentials to connect to PSMDB.
TODO Do not use inner messages in all public APIs (for consistency).

post.summary: CreatePXCCluster creates a new PXC cluster.

name.title:
PXC cluster name.
a DNS-1035 label must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or '-',
start with an alphabetic character, and end with an alphanumeric character
(e.g. 'my-name',  or 'abc-123', regex used for validation is '[a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?')

AddAzureDatabase adds Azure Database instance.

node_model.description:
Represents a purchasable Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) under a product.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/partner-center/develop/product-resources#sku.

address.description: Address used to connect to it.

node_name.description: Unique across all Nodes user-defined name. Defaults to Azure Database instance ID.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name. Defaults to Azure Database instance ID.

qan.description: If true, adds qan-mysql-perfschema-agent or qan-postgresql-pgstatements-agent.

custom_labels.description: Custom user-assigned labels for Node and Service.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

tablestats_group_table_limit.description:
Tablestats group collectors will be disabled if there are more than that number of tables.
If zero, server's default value is used.
Use negative value to disable them.

type.description:
DiscoverAzureDatabaseType describes supported Azure Database instance engines.

 - DISCOVER_AZURE_DATABASE_TYPE_MYSQL: MySQL type: microsoft.dbformysql or MariaDB type: microsoft.dbformariadb
 - DISCOVER_AZURE_DATABASE_TYPE_POSTGRESQL: PostgreSQL type: microsoft.dbformysql

start_time.description: First backup wouldn't happen before this time.

retries.description: How many times to retry a failed backup before giving up.

post.description:
Could return the Error message in the details containing specific ErrorCode indicating failure reason:
ERROR_CODE_XTRABACKUP_NOT_INSTALLED - xtrabackup is not installed on the service
ERROR_CODE_INVALID_XTRABACKUP - different versions of xtrabackup and xbcloud
ERROR_CODE_INCOMPATIBLE_XTRABACKUP - xtrabackup is not compatible with MySQL for taking a backup
ERROR_CODE_INCOMPATIBLE_TARGET_MYSQL - target MySQL version is not compatible with the artifact for performing a restore of the backup
post.summary: RestoreBackup requests the backup restore.

service_id.description: Service identifier where backup should be restored.

retries.description: How many times to retry a failed backup before giving up.

page_params.description: PageParams represents page request parameters for pagination.

page_size.description: Maximum number of results per page.

index.description: Index of the requested page, starts from 0.

items.description: Alert represents Alert.

severity.description: Severity represents severity level of the check result or alert.

status.description:
Status represents Alert Rule's and Alert's combined status.

 - CLEAR: No alert.
 - PENDING: Pending, but not triggering alert.
 - TRIGGERING: Triggering (firing) alert.
 - SILENCED: Silenced alert.

disabled.description: True if that rule is disabled.

items.description: ParamDefinition represents a single query parameter.

name.description: Machine-readable name (ID) that is used in expression.

unit.description:
ParamUnit represents template parameter unit.

 - PARAM_UNIT_INVALID: Invalid, unknown or absent.
 - PERCENTAGE: %
 - SECONDS: s

bool.description: BoolParamDefinition represents boolean parameter's default value.

default.description:
BooleanFlag represent a command to set some boolean property to true,
to false, or avoid changing that property.

 - DO_NOT_CHANGE: Do not change boolean property. Default value.
 - TRUE: True.
 - FALSE: False.

float.description: FloatParamDefinition represents float parameter's default value and valid range.

has_default.description: True if default value is set.

default.description: Default value if has_default is true.

has_min.description: True if minimal valid value is set.

min.description: Minimal valid value (inclusive) if has_min is true.

has_max.description: True if maximal valid value is set.

max.description: Maximal valid value (inclusive) if has_max is true.

string.description: StringParamDefinition represents string parameter's default value.

has_default.description: True if default value is set.

default.description: Default value if has_default is true.

 - EQUAL: =

routing_key.description: The PagerDuty key for "Events API v2" integration type. Exactly one key should be set.

service_key.description: The PagerDuty key for "Prometheus" integration type. Exactly one key should be set.

basic_auth.description: BasicAuth represents basic HTTP auth configuration.

tls_config.title:
TLSConfig represents TLS configuration for alertmanager
https://prometheus.io/docs/alerting/latest/configuration/#tls_config

ca_file.description:
A path to the CA certificate file to validate the server certificate with.
ca_file and ca_file_content should not be set at the same time.

cert_file.description:
A path to the certificate file for client cert authentication to the server.
cert_file and cert_file_content should not be set at the same time.

key_file.description:
A path to the key file for client cert authentication to the server.
key_file and key_file_content should not be set at the same time.

insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable validation of the server certificate.

ca_file_content.description:
CA certificate to validate the server certificate with.
ca_file and ca_file_content should not be set at the same time.

cert_file_content.description:
A certificate for client cert authentication to the server.
cert_file and cert_file_content should not be set at the same time.

key_file_content.description:
A key for client cert authentication to the server.
key_file and key_file_content should not be set at the same time.

disabled.description: True if that channel is disabled.

totals.description: PageTotals represents total values for pagination.

post.description: Pass empty list to apply toggle action to all existing alerts
